page.title: 01Life in old Glapthorn
page.content: Glapthorn was much smaller in the olden days. The roads were stony and people got around by horse and cart. There was only one shop at the top of Glapthorn. There were two pubs in Glapthorn. A fair came every year. Mrs. Wilkinson a farmer's wife gave everybody a feast at Christmas and Easter. There was only one Church and Chapel. The village has changed a lot so has the School. The water came from a well at the Pub. There was a Blacksmiths and a Wheelwright. There has been a lot of houses built. The swimming pool in Oundle was built in 1939 and the roof was put on in 1976. People cooked with a stove over fire, there was no electricity and the drains were terrible.
